item.title: 人工智能聊天机器人如何助长妄想：证词、OpenAI 数据和监管部门的反应
item.description: 一些用户在与 ChatGPT 和其他机器人进行马拉松式的对话时，会忘记现实。【原文：Algunos usuarios están perdiendo la noción de la realidad durante sesiones maratónicas con ChatGPT y otros bots.】

item.title: 前 Stellantis 首席执行官成为葡萄牙亚速尔航空公司唯一竞购者
item.description: 前 Stellantis 首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）表示，他是竞购葡萄牙亚速尔航空公司的唯一财团牵头人，因为大西洋中部群岛政府开始出售这家国有航空公司的最后期限临近。【原文：Former Stellantis Chief Executive Officer Carlos Tavares said he is leading the only consortium bidding for Portugal’s Azores Airlines, as the government of the mid-Atlantic archipelago nears a deadline to start the sale of the state-owned carrier.】

item.title: 首席执行官发出寻求交易的信号，Couche-Tard 盈利大增
item.description: 便利店运营商 Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. 公布盈利增长后，该公司股价大涨，其高层表示正在考虑一些收购目标。【原文：Shares of convenience store operator Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. jumped after the company reported growth in earnings and its top executive said it’s looking at a number of acquisition targets.】

item.title: 美联储加息风险为摩根大通关于 2026 年美元走弱的呼吁蒙上阴影
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）预计明年美元将因美国宽松的货币和财政政策而走软，但同时警告说，对未来加息的加速押注可能会挑战这一观点。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. expects the dollar to soften next year on easier US monetary and fiscal policy, but cautioned that accelerated bets on future interest-rates hikes could challenge that view.】

item.title: 联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）放宽与国债挂钩的关键银行资本规则
item.description: 美国监管机构放宽了资本要求，贷款机构表示，这些要求限制了它们在压力时期充当国债市场中介的能力。【原文：US regulators moved to relax capital requirements that lenders have said limit their ability to act as intermediaries in the Treasuries market during times of stress.】

item.title: 英国吹风限价计划后，机票代理商的贷款一落千丈
item.description: 英国政府计划禁止以高于票面价值的价格转售门票，这可能是音乐会观众的福音，也是体育迷的福音。对于在线黄牛市场 Vivid Seats Inc. 的投资者来说，这则是出售其债务的最新理由。【原文：The UK government’s plan to ban reselling tickets above face value is likely music to the ears of concert-goers and a slam dunk for sports fans. For investors in Vivid Seats Inc. — a marketplace for online scalpers — it’s the latest reason to sell off its debt.】

item.title: 魁北克削减赤字预测，减轻税收负担
item.description: 魁北克省财政部长下调了该省的赤字和借贷，并将为受美国关税影响的工人和某些行业提供税收减免。【原文：Quebec’s finance minister revised the province’s deficit and borrowing downward, and will introduce tax breaks for workers and certain industries affected by US tariffs.】

item.title: 美股涨跌不一，Alphabet威胁英伟达人工智能优势
item.description: 美国股市涨跌不一，原因是 Alphabet 公司威胁到了 Nvidia 公司的主导地位，交易员们在评估延迟发布的经济数据，以寻找有关美联储利率路径的线索。【原文：US stocks were mixed as Alphabet Inc. threatened the dominance of Nvidia Corp. and traders assessed delayed economic data for clues about the interest-rate path of the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: Peloton 的新型人工智能助力自行车和跑步机起步缓慢
item.description: Peloton Interactive 公司的新型人工智能运动设备迄今为止销售低迷，而该设备被誉为长期承诺的扭亏为盈的催化剂。【原文：Peloton Interactive Inc. has so far seen sluggish sales for its new artificial intelligence-powered exercise equipment, billed as the catalyst for a long-promised turnaround.】

item.title: 人工智能泔水食谱占领互联网--还有感恩节晚餐
item.description:
受不可能图片的启发，家庭烹饪者转向人工智能，美食博主的流量因此下降

。【原文：

Food bloggers see traffic dip as home cooks turn to AI, inspired by impossible pictures

】

item.title: 美国消费者对经济的信心创四月以来最大降幅
item.description: 由于对劳动力市场和经济的担忧日益加剧，11月份美国消费者信心下滑幅度为七个月来最大。【原文：US consumer confidence slid in November by the most in seven months on growing anxiety about the labor market and the economy.】

item.title: 美国成屋待售量增幅超过预期
item.description: 由于购房者利用抵押贷款利率下降的机会，10 月份美国旧房待售量的增幅超过了预期。【原文：Pending sales of previously owned US homes rose in October by more than forecast as buyers took advantage of a decline in mortgage rates.】

item.title: 全球人工智能竞赛中沉睡的巨人--谷歌现在 "完全苏醒 "了
item.description: 自从三年前推出 ChatGPT 以来，分析师和技术专家，甚至是谷歌工程师和公司前首席执行官，都宣称谷歌在开发人工智能的高风险竞赛中落后了。【原文：Since the launch of ChatGPT three years ago, analysts and technologists — even a Google engineer and the company’s former chief executive — have declared Google behind in the high-stakes race to develop artificial intelligence.Not anymore.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长称紧缩周期已结束
item.description: 巴西央行行长尼尔顿-戴维（Nilton David）周二表示，将巴西基准利率推向近二十年新高的货币紧缩周期已经结束，并补充说下一步很可能是降息。【原文：A monetary tightening cycle that took Brazil’s benchmark interest rate to a nearly two-decade high has ended, central bank director Nilton David said Tuesday, adding that its next move will likely be a cut.】

item.title: 美国 10 年期国债收益率在更多疲软就业数据的影响下回落至 4% 附近
item.description: 国债收益率走低，10 年期国债收益率接近 4%，原因是确认劳动力市场疲软的数据和美联储理事斯蒂芬-米兰的讲话增强了下月降息的预期。【原文：Treasury yields edged lower, with the 10-year nearing 4%, as data affirming labor-market weakness and remarks from Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran bolstered expectations for an interest-rate cut next month.】

item.title: 谷歌的 TPU 如何让 Nvidia 望尘莫及？
item.description: 自从英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）在人工智能芯片市场占据主导地位以来，客户就明确表示他们希望看到更多的竞争。事实证明，最强大的替代品之一可能一直隐藏在人们的视线中。【原文：For as long as Nvidia Corp. has dominated the market for artificial intelligence chips, customers have made clear they’d like to see more competition. It turns out one of the most formidable alternatives may have been hiding in plain sight.】

item.title: 欧盟将芬兰列入违反其财政规则的国家名单
item.description: 在赫尔辛基政府未能控制公共财政缺口之后，欧盟正准备将芬兰列入违反其财政规则的成员国名单。【原文：The European Union is preparing to add Finland to the list of member states in breach of its fiscal rules after the government in Helsinki failed to rein in a shortfall in public finances.】

item.title: 美国 9 月房价增长放缓，买家回流
item.description: 由于经济的不确定性使有意购房者退而求其次，9 月份房价增长放缓。【原文：Home price growth slowed in September as economic uncertainty pushed would-be buyers to the sidelines.】

item.title: 贝森特结束候选人面试时呼吁简化美联储程序
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，他在面试美联储下一任主席时的一个关键主题是简化美国中央银行，他表示该银行在管理货币市场方面已经变得过于复杂。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that a key theme of his interviews for the next chair of the Federal Reserve has been simplifying the US central bank, which he indicated has become too complex in how it manages money markets.】

item.title: 嘀嗒商店推出价值 1.1 万美元的手袋，进军奢侈品零售业
item.description: TikTok 正在进军奢侈品零售业，努力将其 TikTok Shop 市场拓展为高端购物目的地，销售价值数千美元的皮包和手表。【原文：TikTok is moving into luxury retail, part of an effort to expand its TikTok Shop marketplace into a high-end shopping destination for purses and watches that can fetch thousands of dollars.】

item.title: 国泰君安抨击摩根大通最大 ETF，随后又出尔反尔
item.description: 一开始，金融顾问们的收件箱里充斥着这样的推销信息。只不过这一次，道富投资管理公司（State Street Investment Management）用它来抨击摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：It began as the kind of sales pitch that floods the inboxes of financial advisers. Except this time, State Street Investment Management used it to take a swipe at one of JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s showcase ETFs, a head-turning move that cut through the industry’s usual politeness.】

item.title: 欧佩克+国家再次面临能抽多少油的棘手问题
item.description: 本周末，欧佩克+国家再次聚首一堂，共同探讨他们实际能够泵出多少石油这一棘手问题。【原文：OPEC+ nations gathering this weekend are once again grappling with the thorny question of how much oil they’re physically able to pump.】

item.title: 美国生产者价格指数增长 0.3%，能源价格上涨带动增长
item.description: 美国 9 月份的批发通胀率较上月有所上升，反映出能源和食品成本的上涨。【原文：US wholesale inflation picked up in September from a month earlier, reflecting higher energy and food costs.】

item.title: 美国 9 月零售销售因消费者退缩而失去动力
item.description: 美国 9 月份的零售额小幅增长，表明一些消费者在经历了几个月的强劲消费后暂停了消费。【原文：US retail sales rose modestly in September, suggesting some consumers hit pause after several months of robust spending.】

item.title: 报道称乌克兰可能达成和平协议，铜价跳涨
item.description: 伦敦铜价升至每吨 11,000 美元，有报道称乌克兰已同意美国斡旋的和平协议条款，这在供应趋紧的情况下提振了市场情绪。【原文：Copper rose towards $11,000 a ton in London, with a report that Ukraine has agreed to terms for a US-brokered peace deal bolstering sentiment at a time of tightening supply.】

item.title: 风力发电量下降导致欧洲短期电价飙升
item.description: 由于风力发电量急剧下降，又恰逢寒流来袭，欧洲短期电力价格飙升，德国是该地区最紧张的市场。【原文：European short-term power prices spiked, with Germany the tightest market in the region, as a sharp drop in wind generation coincided with a cold snap.】

item.title: 里夫斯计划减免股票税以促进伦敦上市
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将在周三的预算案中宣布对伦敦证券交易所的新上市公司实行为期三年的印花税免税期，政府将加大力度重振萎靡不振的市场。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will announce a three-year stamp duty holiday for new listings on the London Stock Exchange in her budget on Wednesday, as the government ramps up efforts to revive the ailing market.】

item.title: 尼日利亚意外维持利率不变以抑制物价压力
item.description: 尽管人们预期非洲最大的石油生产国尼日利亚的通胀将继续降温，但尼日利亚央行出人意料地保持利率稳定。【原文：Nigeria’s central bank unexpectedly held interest rates steady, despite expectations that inflation will continue to cool in Africa’s largest oil producer.】

item.title: 波兰将于 2026 年初提出数字服务税计划
item.description: 波兰正在起草对在线平台征税的法律，以寻求为本地企业创造公平的竞争环境，因为在这个东欧国家，外国竞争对手不需要缴纳税款。【原文：Poland is drafting legislation to tax online platforms, seeking to level the playing field for local firms whose foreign competitors aren’t subject to levies in the east European country.】

item.title: 随着市场兴趣减退，美国房屋销售商将陈旧房源撤出市场
item.description: 随着美国房地产业的停滞不前，美国的房屋销售商正在将房源撤出市场。【原文：Homesellers in the US are yanking listings off the market, as the nation’s real estate sector stagnates.】
